required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Perioperative Warming Measures in Cesarean Delivery
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Control Trial Assessing Effectiveness of Perioperative Warming Measures in Parturients Undergoing Cesarean Delivery

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the best method for keeping patients warm during cesarean deliveries and the effect of temperature change on the patient and baby

primary_outcome.measure: Change in maternal core body temperature
primary_outcome.time_frame: preoperative/beginning of surgery ,postoperative/end of surgery (4 hours after anesthesia)
preoperative/beginning of surgery ,postoperative/end of surgery (4 hours after anesthesia)
primary_outcome.description: Hypothermia is indicated as core temperature < 36 °C

primary_outcome.measure: Neonate status as determined by Appearance, Pulse, Grimace, Activity, and Respiration (APGAR) score
primary_outcome.description: Five criteria are scored and each one is scored form 0-2 with a total score of 10, a higher score indicating a better outcome.

primary_outcome.measure: Neonate status as determined by Umbilical Artery PH

primary_outcome.time_frame: end of surgery (4 hours after anesthesia)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: on arrival to Post anesthesia Care Unit (PACU) [about 4 hours after anesthesia]
secondary_outcome.description: Degree of shivering is measured from 0(no shivering)-3(total body shivering)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients that need meperidine
secondary_outcome.time_frame: on arrival to PACU [about 4 hours after anesthesia]

secondary_outcome.description: Degree of shivering is measured from 0(no shivering)-3(total body shivering)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients that need meperidine

secondary_outcome.time_frame: after administration of meperidine, if it applies (about 30 minutes in PACU)
secondary_outcome.description: Degree of shivering is measured from 0(no shivering)-3(total body shivering)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients that show Maternal thermal comfort
secondary_outcome.time_frame: end of surgery (4 hours after anesthesia)
secondary_outcome.description: scored form 0-10,a higher number indicating more thermal comfort

secondary_outcome.time_frame: end of surgery (4 hours ater anesthesia)
Time of admission to time of discharge (about 72 hours after surgery)

arm_group.description: Preop: Use of full body forced air warming pre-operative at ambient (32˚C) for at least 30 minutes and fluids from warmed cabinet set at 45˚C Intraop: Use of upper body and lower forced air warming intra-operative at 32 and 42˚C respectively and IV fluids with hotline fluid warmer set at 42˚C

Preop: Use of full body forced air warming pre-operative at ambient (32˚C) for at least 30 minutes and fluids from warmed cabinet set at 45˚C Intraop: Use of upper body forced air warming intra-operative at ambient (32˚C) and IV fluids at room temperature

intervention.intervention_name: Pre op upper body forced air warming (32˚C)
intervention.description: Use of upper body forced air warming at ambient (32˚C) for at least 30 minutes

intervention.intervention_name: Pre op lower body forced air warming (32˚C)
intervention.description: lower body forced air warming at ambient (32˚C) for at least 30 minutes
fluids from warmed cabinet set at 45˚C

intervention.intervention_name: Intra op upper body forced air warming (32˚C)
intervention.description: Use of upper body forced air warming intra-operative at ambient (32˚C)

intervention.intervention_name: Intra op fluids at room temperature
Intra op upper body forced air warming at (32˚C)
intervention.description: upper body forced air warming intra-operative at ambient (32˚C)

intervention.intervention_name: Intra op upper body forced air warming at (42˚C)
intervention.description: upper body forced air warming intra-operative at ambient (42˚C)

intervention.intervention_name: Intra op lower body forced air warming at (32˚C)
intervention.description: Lower body forced air warming intra-operative at ambient (32˚C)

intervention.intervention_name: Intra op lower body forced air warming at (42˚C)
intervention.description: Lower body forced air warming intra-operative at ambient (42˚C)
IV fluids with hotline fluid warmer set at 42˚C

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- scheduled for elective cesarean section under neuraxial anesthesia
- singleton pregnancy
Exclusion Criteria:
- gestational age of less than 37 week
- emergency cesarean

overall_official.affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

facility.name: The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston
